info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 1:43AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lake, northern Missoula and southeastern Sanders Counties through 230 AM MDT... At 142 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ronan, or 16 miles south of Polson, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Polson, Ronan, Pablo, Jette, Turtle Lake, Kings Point, Rocky Point, Kerr, Allentown, Kicking Horse, Round Butte, Charlo, Fort Connah, Finley Point and Salmon Prairie. This includes the following highways... Highway 83 between mile markers 49 and 58. Highway 93 between mile markers 34 and 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
